alert.note: Alert for Pierce (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 12:55AM PST until January 07 at 8:17PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... South Prairie Creek at South Prairie affecting Pierce County. .Heavy rain over the Central Washington Cascades along with the Puget Sound lowlands pushed South Prairie Creek at South Prairie above flood stage Thursday. The river will recede below flood stage late this morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Prairie Creek at South Prairie. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 4000.0 cfs, South Prairie Creek will flood low lying areas and roads from the Town of South Prairie downstream to the Carbon River near Orting. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM PST Friday the flow was 5420.0 cfs. - Recent Activity...The maximum river flow in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 AM PST Friday was 6260.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling this afternoon and tonight. - Flood flow is 4000.0 cfs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 1200 PM PST.
